name: Osteospermum
description: Osteospermum is a genus of about 50 species of annuals, perennials and sub-shrubs in the family Asteraceae.Osteospermum has beautiful daisy-like flowers in a variety of colors. Like other members of the Asteraceae family, the blooms are actually flower heads composed of a central disc which contains a number of tiny individual flowers known as florets. Most of the species have flat petals, although there are some lovely varieties with spoon-shaped petals. Osteospermums are easy to maintain and will provide an abundance of color for many months.
meaning: The genus name is derived from the Greek “osteon”, meaning “bone” and Latin “spermum”, which means “seed”. The plant is native to Africa, hence the common name “African Daisy”.
color_description: The flowers come in numerous colors and shades including blue, purple, mauve, pink, yellow, white and cream.
